scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of 3 items. In a letter, 1889 November 9, Marion Harland (Mary Virginia Terhune), New York City, writes to Mrs. Marble with best wishes on the latter's marriage and discusses circulation of Harland's magazine, The Homemaker. Also included in the collection are an undated photograph of Harland and a paragraph, 1894 October 31, she wrote concerning marriage: "when a man marries a woman who is manifestly his mental superior."
